senselogic.sitevision.api.user

Interface SystemUserUtil


  • @Requireable(value="SystemUserUtil")
public interface SystemUserUtil
    System user utility interface.

    This interface handles nodes with primary node type sv:systemUser, i.e. the Anonymous, System, Indexer, Validator and Extractor user.

    An instance of the Sitevision class implementing this interface can be obtained via UserFactory.getSystemUserUtil(). See UserFactory for how to obtain an instance of the UserFactory interface.

    Since:
    Sitevision 3.6
    Author:
    Magnus LÃ¶vgren

    • Method Detail

      • isAnySystemUser

        boolean isAnySystemUser()
        Checks if current user is any system user (Anonymous, System, Indexer, Validator, Extractor).

        This is a convenience method that is much more efficient than checking for each system user type instance separately.

        Javascript code that uses SystemUserUtil like this: 

        const isLoggedInHuman = () => {
   return (
     !systemUserUtil.isAnonymous() &&
     !systemUserUtil.isSystem() &&
     !systemUserUtil.isIndexer() &&
     !systemUserUtil.isValidator() &&
     !systemUserUtil.isExtractor()
   );
 };

        Should be replaced with code that uses this method instead: 

        const isLoggedInHuman = () => {
   return !systemUserUtil.isAnySystemUser();
 };

        Note! This method does NOT produce a reliable result if called during the authentication process (i.e. from a JAAS filter or JAAS module) since it relies on a fully loaded current user (as of PortletContextUtil.getCurrentUser()).

        Returns:
        returns true if the current user is any system user (Anonymous, System, Indexer, Validator, Extractor), false otherwise
        Since:
        Sitevision 2024.10.1
        See Also:
        isAnySystemUser(Node)

      • isAnySystemUser

        boolean isAnySystemUser(Node aUserNode)
        Checks if a user node is any system user (Anonymous, System, Validator, Indexer, Extractor).

        This is a convenience method that checks if a given user node is any system user (Anonymous, System, Validator, Indexer, Extractor). Note that method is equivalent to checking the node type via NodeTypeUtil.isSystemUser(aUserNode).

        Parameters:
        aUserNode - a user node
        Returns:
        returns true if aUserNode is any system user (Anonymous, System, Validator, Indexer, Extractor), false otherwise
        Since:
        Sitevision 2024.10.1
        See Also:
        NodeTypeUtil.isSystemUser(Node)

      • isAnonymous

        boolean isAnonymous()
        Checks if current user is anonymous (not authenticated).

        An Anonymous user is not authenticated and can only access public resources.

        Note! This method does NOT produce a reliable result if called during the authentication process (i.e. from a JAAS filter or JAAS module) since it relies on a fully loaded current user (as of PortletContextUtil.getCurrentUser()).

        Returns:
        true if current user is Anonymous (i.e. not authenticated), false otherwise

      • isAnonymous

        boolean isAnonymous(Node aUserNode)
        Checks if a user node is anonymous (not authenticated).

        An Anonymous user is not authenticated and can only access public resources.

        Parameters:
        aUserNode - a user node
        Returns:
        true if aUserNode is anonymous (i.e. not authenticated), false otherwise (i.e. no match or aUserNode is null)

      • isSystem

        boolean isSystem()
        Checks if current user is the Sitevision System user.

        The System user has all permissions and full access to all Sitevision portlets and functionality allowed by the current license(-s).

        Note! This method does NOT produce a reliable result if called during the authentication process (i.e. from a JAAS filter or JAAS module) since it relies on a fully loaded current user (as of PortletContextUtil.getCurrentUser()).

        Returns:
        true if current user is the Sitevision System user, false otherwise

      • isSystem

        boolean isSystem(Node aUserNode)
        Checks if a user node is the Sitevision System user.

        The System user has all permissions and full access to all Sitevision portlets and functionality allowed by the current license(-s).

        Parameters:
        aUserNode - a user node
        Returns:
        true if aUserNode is the Sitevision System user, false otherwise (i.e. no match or aUserNode is null)

      • isIndexer

        boolean isIndexer()
        Checks if current user is the Sitevision Indexer.

        The Indexer user has read permission on all resources and visits/renders pages in order to collect metadata/content and such that should be indexed by the Sitevision search engine.

        Note! This method does NOT produce a reliable result if called during the authentication process (i.e. from a JAAS filter or JAAS module) since it relies on a fully loaded current user (as of PortletContextUtil.getCurrentUser()).

        Returns:
        true if current user is the Sitevision Indexer, false otherwise

      • isIndexer

        boolean isIndexer(Node aUserNode)
        Checks if a user node is the Sitevision Indexer.

        The Indexer user has read permission on all resources and visits/renders pages in order to collect metadata/content and such that should be indexed by the Sitevision search engine.

        Parameters:
        aUserNode - a user node
        Returns:
        true if aUserNode is the Sitevision Indexer, false otherwise (i.e. no match or aUserNode is null)

      • isValidator

        boolean isValidator()
        Checks if current user is the Sitevision Validator.

        The Validator user has read permission on all resources and visits/renders pages in order to validate them.

        Note! This method does NOT produce a reliable result if called during the authentication process (i.e. from a JAAS filter or JAAS module) since it relies on a fully loaded current user (as of PortletContextUtil.getCurrentUser()).

        Returns:
        true if current user is the Sitevision Validator, false otherwise
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.2.3

      • isValidator

        boolean isValidator(Node aUserNode)
        Checks if a user node is the Sitevision Validator.

        The Validator user has read permission on all resources and visits/renders pages in order to validate them.

        Parameters:
        aUserNode - a user node
        Returns:
        true if aUserNode is the Sitevision Validator, false otherwise (i.e. no match or aUserNode is null)
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.2.3

      • isExtractor

        boolean isExtractor()
        Checks if current user is the Sitevision Extractor.

        The Extractor user has read permission on all resources and renders pages in order to store their content as static html pages.

        Note! This method does NOT produce a reliable result if called during the authentication process (i.e. from a JAAS filter or JAAS module) since it relies on a fully loaded current user (as of PortletContextUtil.getCurrentUser()).

        Returns:
        true if current user is the Sitevision Extractor, false otherwise

      • isExtractor

        boolean isExtractor(Node aUserNode)
        Checks if a user node is the Sitevision Extractor.

        The Extractor user has read permission on all resources and renders pages in order to store their content as static html pages.

        Parameters:
        aUserNode - a user node
        Returns:
        true if aUserNode is the Sitevision Extractor, false otherwise (i.e. no match or aUserNode is null)

Sitevision - Portal and Content Management Made Easy
Sitevision is an advanced Java enterprise portal product and a portlet container (JSR 286) that implements Java Content Repository (JSR 283).
